item.title: The mysteriously delayed Supreme Court tariffs ruling
item.description: The Trump administration, though the underdog, will find each passing week an encouraging sign.

item.title: Trump’s pro-coal directives could raise energy prices by billions
item.description: Requiring aging plants to operate after their scheduled closures hurts consumers, who pay the price.

item.title: D.C.’s glacial response to the winter storm
item.description: It’s fair for taxpayers to question why it’s taking so long for the city to recover.

item.title: This pragmatism has a price
item.description: The U.K. traded far more away in its “reset” with China than it gained in trade deals or investment.

item.title: Fellow Republicans, join me in becoming a Democrat
item.description: D.C. politics, love letters and family secrets, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: Flirting is trickier than ever. Here are some tips.
item.description: Dating and politics, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: Americans now know what they’re against. They saw it in Minneapolis.
item.description: Federal overreach and shooting deaths of citizens might finally unite a divided nation.

item.title: A ‘geyser’ of sewage turns back the clock on the Potomac
item.description: An urban river can only be as healthy as the infrastructure built to protect it.

item.title: Kevin Warsh steps into an opportunity
item.description: The Fed chair nominee is right that the central bank has lost its focus. He can get it on track.

item.title: The deportations that swing voters actually want
item.description: Interior immigration enforcement risks overshadowing Trump’s success at the border.

item.title: Tie the Fed’s hands. For everyone’s sake.
item.description: Personal courage won’t save the central bank. Binding monetary rules will.

item.title: Minnesota could finally teach Trump the limits of theatrics
item.description: The president is learning a hard lesson about policy versus personnel.

item.title: DeepSeek was a warning shot. China is building its next surprise.
item.description: Beijing has a dominant lead in developing intelligent robots, drones and autonomous systems.

item.title: With this decision, the Supreme Court can and should rein Trump in
item.description: A pending landmark ruling will address the president’s power to fire within the executive branch.

item.title: Why communist leaders purge their generals
item.description: China’s latest military purge is part of a long tradition.
